text.0: o agni shared by all men living bring us good luck for sacrifice from earth and heaven.
text.1: with us be thine intelligence wonderworker protect us god with thy farreaching blessings.
text.2: these hymns brought forth for thee o agni laud thee for bounteous gifts with cattle and with horses.
text.3: good lord when man from thee hath gained enjoyment by hymns o noblyborn hath he obtained it.
text.4: agni i deem my kinsman and my father count him my brother and my friend for ever.
text.5: i honour as the face of lofty agni in heaven the bright and holy light of sūrya.
text.6: effectual agni are our prayers for profit he whom at home thou priest for ever guardest.
text.7: is rich in food drawn by red steeds and holy by day and night to him shall all be pleasant.
text.8: men with their arms have generated agni helpful as some kind friend adorned with splendours.
text.9: and stablished as invoker mid the people the ancient priest the sacrifices lover.
text.10: worship thyself o god the gods in heaven what void of knowledge shall the fool avail thee.
text.11: as thou o god hast worshipped gods by seasons so noblyborn to thine own self pay worship.
text.12: agni be thou our guardian and protector bestow upon us life and vital vigour.
text.13: accept o mighty one the gifts we offer and with unceasing care protect our bodies.
